trans-unit.source: How to create a classic VNet in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: How to create a classic VNet in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To create a classic VNet based on the scenario above, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To create a classic VNet based on the scenario above, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: From a browser, navigate to http://portal.azure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: From a browser, navigate to http://portal.azure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW** > **Networking** > **Virtual network**, notice that the **Select a deployment model** list already shows **Classic**, and then click **Create**, as seen in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW** > **Networking** > **Virtual network**, notice that the **Select a deployment model** list already shows **Classic**, and then click **Create**, as seen in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: Create VNet in preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create VNet in preview portal

trans-unit.source: On the **Virtual network** blade, type the **Name** of the VNet, and then click **Address space**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Virtual network** blade, type the **Name** of the VNet, and then click **Address space**.

trans-unit.source: Configure your address space settings for the VNet and its first subnet, then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Configure your address space settings for the VNet and its first subnet, then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the CIDR block settings for our scenario.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the CIDR block settings for our scenario.

trans-unit.source: Address space blade
trans-unit.target: Address space blade

trans-unit.source: Click **Resource Group** and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click **Create new resource group** to add the VNet to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Click **Resource Group** and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click **Create new resource group** to add the VNet to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called **TestRG**.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called **TestRG**.

trans-unit.source: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).
trans-unit.target: For more information about resource groups, visit [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md/#resource-groups).

trans-unit.source: Create resource group blade
trans-unit.target: Create resource group blade

trans-unit.source: If necessary, change the **Subscription** and **Location** settings for your VNet.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, change the **Subscription** and **Location** settings for your VNet.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the **Startboard**, disable **Pin to Startboard**.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the **Startboard**, disable **Pin to Startboard**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** and notice the tile named **Creating Virtual network** as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** and notice the tile named **Creating Virtual network** as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: Create VNet in portal
trans-unit.target: Create VNet in portal

trans-unit.source: Wait for the VNet to be created, and when you see the tile below, click it to add more subnets.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the VNet to be created, and when you see the tile below, click it to add more subnets.

trans-unit.source: Create VNet in portal
trans-unit.target: Create VNet in portal

trans-unit.source: You should see the **Configuration** for your VNet as shown below.
trans-unit.target: You should see the **Configuration** for your VNet as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Create VNet in portal
trans-unit.target: Create VNet in portal

trans-unit.source: Click **Subnets** > **Add**, then type a **Name** and specify an **Address range (CIDR block)** for your subnet, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Subnets** > **Add**, then type a **Name** and specify an **Address range (CIDR block)** for your subnet, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the settings for our current scenario.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the settings for our current scenario.

trans-unit.source: Create VNet in preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create VNet in preview portal
